website_summaries.verdict: While heavier and not as powerful as similar models, this sander stands out for its comfort and quality.
pros: Great amount of power for heavy equipment applications
Smooth operation makes it very comfortable to operate
cons: A bit larger and heavier than other models
Some buyers note that this sander seems to have less power than others

customer_reviews.title: smooth running and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the pad was a good density, not too hard or soft. The unit operates very smooth and it is not too bad on air consumption if you dial back the pressure and control the flow for the task at hand. Granted, if you need the full power, it will consume air. I'm mostly sanding primer or filler, so throttling the air helps reduce compressor cycling and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great aggressive sander
customer_reviews.text: Working in a higher end shop where we do Porsche & Audi for 90% of our work. I have two other DA sanders (Hutchins & Snap-On), that are finishing DA’s that I sue majority of the time. When is comes to cutting and stripping of bumpers and hoods, this beast gets the job done a lot quicker. When we stripping a bumper job with the finishing sanders, it would take 1.5-2 hours, where as with this one it takes 30 tops. Well worth the price!. Plan on using this to strip down my 72 Nova
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 20hrs of use
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised that the DA sander failed after 20 hours of use. While it was working, it did a great job sanding. I actually had to slow it down, and use a higher grit sandpaper to slow down how much material it would take off. I gave it 3 stars because it failed so quickly. This was replacing a DA sander that i had used for years in a wood shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaces a $275 Similar Sander in our Commercial Sign Shop. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We are using this in a commercial sign shop, in place of a $275 unit of very similar design. For sanding aluminum sheets and awning frames -- this works great. We'll see how long it lasts, but if it lasts a year then it's far cheaper to buy this unit than the comparable "industrial brand" that is so much higher-priced. Uses the same sanding disks. The guys using it are picky -- and they are impressed. I haven't told them the price! :-) UPDATE 12/8/2018... Not only has this lasted, but the guys in the shop like them so much, we've bought three more. Bargain price for the value.

product_meta.title: Chicago Pneumatic CP870 Dual Action Sander
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Chicago Pneumatic Dual Action Sander is ideal for blending and smoothing filler, feather edging and pre-paint preparation. Powered by a 0.5 HP motor, it produces 5,000 RPM of free speed. This dual action sander provides both rotary and orbital motion for rapid removal, and a fine finishing speed regulator to match speed to the job. A lock off throttle prevents accidental start ups and an insulated grip provides comfort to the operator. The air inlet measures 1/4 inches in diameter with a 3/8-inch diameter hose. The sand paper size is 6-by-9-inches.
